Title: Object: Group of Figures Entering Madrid
Description: A man wearing a heavy cloak and soft hat, riding a donkey, accompanied by a stout man in religious habit and hat, walking with a stick and a lantern, a young woman to right of him who glances back at the rider and a chilid wearing a plumed hat, beating a drum, all proceeding across barren ground into the right foreground. Lithograph printed in grey and beige
Curator's comments: Very similar in style and format to 'Sir David Wilkie's Sketches in Turkey, Syria & Egypt, 1840 & 1841', a set of lithographs of oriental subjects by Nash after Wilkie which were published in two volumes, London, 1843 and 1846 (1918,0205.2-8). Wilkie visited the continent, including Spain, in 1825-1827.
